results.title: Mother's little helpers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the problem of depressed housewives who are becoming addicted to drugs, particularly tranquilizers prescribed by their doctors to help them cope with life.

results.title: The Cancer gas
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Vinyl chloride monomer is a gas used in the making of PVC - one of the most common forms of plastic. Scientists now believe that workmen breathing the fumes of VCM can contract cancer of the liver.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: The Peace War
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The Peace War looks at the growing power of peace movements in Europe and the propaganda victories won by the proponents of nuclear disarmament. Examines the arguments for and against the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament in Britain.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Sex and violence
results.creator_credit: Linda McDoogall and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The anti-rape movement in the United States is of concern to the feminist movement. Shows the activities of rape crisis centres and in particular deals with the activities of the organisation Women Organised Against Rape, which is based in Philadelphia, and handles l,000 rape cases a year.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The anti-rape movement in the United States is of concern to the feminist movement. Shows the activities of rape crisis centres and in particular deals with the activities of the organisation Women Organised Against Rape, which is based in Philadelphia, and handles l,000 rape cases a year.
description_for_label:

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty eight up continues the World in action series, following the development and changing attitudes of a group of British children every seven years, they are now twenty eight. This program talks to Tony, Bruce and Suzi.

results.title: Seven up
results.creator_credit: Paul Almond, Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “World in action”.
Life viewed by Britain’s seven year olds. They give their views on life, leisure, love, marriage, colour prejudice, education, money and their ambitions for the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Almond, Michael Apted and Granada Television International
